dataType.name: IPAddress
dataType.description:
IP address, i.e. IPv4 address (or IPv4 subnet mask) or IPv6 address.
All IPv4 addresses and subnet masks MUST be represented as strings in IPv4 dotted-decimal notation. Here are some examples of valid IPv4 address textual representations:
* 216.52.29.100
* 192.168.1.254
All IPv6 addresses MUST be represented using any of the 3 standard textual representations defined in {{bibref|RFC4291}} Sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2 and 2.2.3. Both lower-case and upper-case letters can be used, but use of lower-case letters is RECOMMENDED. Here are some examples of valid IPv6 address textual representations:
* 1080:0:0:800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd
* 1080::800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd
* 0:0:0:0:0:0:13.1.68.3
IPv6 addresses MUST NOT include zone identifiers. Zone identifiers are discussed in {{bibref|RFC4007|Section 6}}.
Unspecified or inapplicable addresses (or IPv4 subnet masks) MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: MACAddress
dataType.description: All MAC addresses are represented as strings of 12 hexadecimal digits (digits 0-9, letters A-F or a-f) displayed as six pairs of digits separated by colons. Unspecified or inapplicable MAC addresses MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.
object.description: The top-level object for an Internet Gateway Device.

parameter.name: LANDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|LANDevice}}.

parameter.name: WANDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WANDevice}}.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.DeviceInfo.
object.description: This object contains general device information.

parameter.name: Manufacturer
parameter.description: The manufacturer of the CPE (human readable string).

parameter.name: ManufacturerOUI
parameter.description: Organizationally unique identifier of the device manufacturer. Represented as a six hexadecimal-digit value using all upper-case letters and including any leading zeros. The value MUST be a valid OUI as defined in {{bibref|OUI}}.

parameter.name: ModelName
parameter.description: Model name of the CPE (human readable string).

parameter.name: Description
parameter.description: A full description of the CPE device (human readable string).

parameter.name: ProductClass
parameter.description: Identifier of the class of product for which the serial number applies. That is, for a given manufacturer, this parameter is used to identify the product or class of product over which the {{param|SerialNumber}} parameter is unique.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description: Serial number of the CPE.

parameter.name: HardwareVersion
parameter.description: A string identifying the particular CPE model and version.

parameter.name: SoftwareVersion
parameter.description: A string identifying the software version currently installed in the CPE. To allow version comparisons, this element SHOULD be in the form of dot-delimited integers, where each successive integer represents a more minor category of variation. For example, ''3.0.21''where the components mean: ''Major.Minor.Build''.

parameter.name: ModemFirmwareVersion
parameter.description: A string identifying the version of the modem firmware currently installed in the CPE. This is applicable only when the modem firmware is separable from the overall CPE software.

parameter.name: EnabledOptions
parameter.description: The OptionName of each Option that is currently enabled in the CPE. The OptionName of each is identical to the OptionName element of the OptionStruct described in {{bibref|TR-069|Table 48}}. Only those options are listed whose State indicates the option is enabled.

parameter.name: AdditionalHardwareVersion
parameter.description: Represents any additional hardware version information the vendor may wish to supply.

parameter.name: AdditionalSoftwareVersion
parameter.description: Represents any additional software version information the vendor may wish to supply.

parameter.name: SpecVersion
parameter.description: Represents the version of the specification implemented by the device. Currently 1.0 is the only available version.

parameter.name: ProvisioningCode
parameter.description: Identifier of the primary service provider and other provisioning information, which MAY be used by the Server to determine service provider-specific customization and provisioning parameters. If not {{empty}}, this argument SHOULD be in the form of a hierarchical descriptor with one or more nodes specified. Each node in the hierarchy is represented as a 4-character sub-string, containing only numerals or upper-case letters. If there is more than one node indicated, each node is separated by a "." (dot). Examples: "TLCO" or "TLCO.GRP2".

parameter.name: UpTime
parameter.description: Time in seconds since the CPE was last restarted.

parameter.name: FirstUseDate
parameter.description: Date and time in UTC that the CPE first successfully established a network connection.

parameter.name: DeviceLog
parameter.description: Vendor-specific log(s).

parameter.name: VendorConfigFileNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|VendorConfigFile}}.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.DeviceInfo.VendorConfigFile.{i}.
object.description: Every instance of this object is a Vendor Configuration File, and contains parameters associated with the Vendor Configuration File.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the vendor configuration file.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: A string identifying the configuration file version currently used in the CPE.

parameter.name: Date
parameter.description: Date and time when the content of the current version of this vendor configuration file was first applied by the CPE.

parameter.name: Description
parameter.description: A description of the vendor configuration file (human-readable string).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.DeviceConfig.
object.description: This object contains general configuration parameters.

parameter.name: PersistentData
parameter.description: Arbitrary user data that must persist across CPE reboots.

parameter.name: ConfigFile
parameter.description: A dump of the currently running configuration on the CPE. This parameter enables the ability to backup and restore the last known good state of the CPE. It returns a vendor-specific document that defines the state of the CPE. The document must be capable of restoring the CPE's state when written back to the CPE using SetParameterValues.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.ManagementServer.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the CPE's association with an ACS.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description: URL for the CPE to connect to the ACS using the CPE WAN Management Protocol. This parameter MUST be in the form of a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL {{bibref|RFC2616}}. An HTTPS URL indicates that the ACS supports SSL. The ''host'' portion of this URL is used by the CPE for validating the certificate from the ACS when using certificate-based authentication.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate the CPE when making a connection to the ACS using the CPE WAN Management Protocol. This username is used only for HTTP-based authentication of the CPE.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate the CPE when making a connection to the ACS using the CPE WAN Management Protocol. This password is used only for HTTP-based authentication of the CPE.

parameter.name: PeriodicInformEnable
parameter.description: Whether or not the CPE must periodically send CPE information to Server using the Inform method call.

parameter.name: PeriodicInformInterval
parameter.description: The duration in seconds of the interval for which the CPE MUST attempt to connect with the ACS and call the Inform method if {{param|PeriodicInformEnable}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: PeriodicInformTime
parameter.description: An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE should initiate the Inform method calls. Each Inform call must occur at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInformInterval}}. A zero dateTime value (0000-00-00T00:00:00) indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE may locally choose the time reference, required only to adhere to the specified {{param|PeriodicInformInterval}}.

parameter.name: ParameterKey
parameter.description: The value of the ParameterKey argument from the most recent SetParameterValues, AddObject, or DeleteObject method call from the Server. If there have been no such calls, this value is empty.

parameter.name: ConnectionRequestURL
parameter.description:
HTTP URL for an ACS to make a Connection Request notification to the CPE. In the form:
: http://host:port/path The ''host'' portion of the URL MAY be the IP address for the management interface of the CPE in lieu of a host name.

parameter.name: ConnectionRequestUsername
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate an ACS making a Connection Request to the CPE.

parameter.name: ConnectionRequestPassword
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate an ACS making a Connection Request to the CPE.

parameter.name: UpgradesManaged
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the ACS will manage upgrades for the CPE. If {{true}}, the CPE SHOULD not use other means other than the ACS to seek out available upgrades. If {{false}}, the CPE MAY use other means for this purpose.

parameter.name: KickURL
parameter.description: Present only for a CPE that supports the Kicked RPC method. LAN-accessible URL from which the CPE can be "kicked" to initiate the Kicked RPC method call. MUST be an absolute URL including a host name or IP address as would be used on the LAN side of the CPE.

parameter.name: DownloadProgressURL
parameter.description: Present only for a CPE that provides a LAN-side web page to show progress during a file download. LAN-accessible URL to which a web-server associated with the ACS may redirect a user's browser on initiation of a file download to observer the status of the download.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.Time.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating an NTP or SNTP time client in the CPE. Support for this object is Optional.

parameter.name: NTPServer1
parameter.description: First NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer2
parameter.description: Second NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer3
parameter.description: Third NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer4
parameter.description: Fourth NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer5
parameter.description: Fifth NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: CurrentLocalTime
parameter.description: The current date and time in the CPE's local time zone.

parameter.name: LocalTimeZone
parameter.description:
The local time offset from UTC in the form:
: +hh:mm
: -hh:mm

parameter.name: LocalTimeZoneName
parameter.description: Name of the local time zone (human readable string).

parameter.name: DaylightSavingsUsed
parameter.description: Whether or not daylight savings time is in use in the CPE's local time zone.

parameter.name: DaylightSavingsStart
parameter.description: Date and time daylight savings time begins if used in local standard time. If daylight savings time is not used, this value is ignored.

parameter.name: DaylightSavingsEnd
parameter.description: Date and time daylight savings time ends if used in local daylight time. If daylight savings time is not used, this value is ignored.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.UserInterface.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the user interface of the CPE. Support for this object is Optional.

parameter.name: PasswordRequired
parameter.description: Present only if the CPE provides a password-protected LAN-side user interface. Indicates whether or not the local user interface must require a password to be chosen by the user. If {{false}}, the choice of whether or not a password is used is left to the user.

parameter.name: PasswordUserSelectable
parameter.description: Present only if the CPE provides a password-protected LAN-side user interface and supports LAN-side Auto-Configuration. Indicates whether or not a password to protect the local user interface of the CPE may be selected by the user directly, or must be equal to the password used by the LAN-side Auto-Configuration protocol.

parameter.name: UpgradeAvailable
parameter.description: Indicates that a CPE upgrade is available, allowing the CPE to display this information to the user.

parameter.name: WarrantyDate
parameter.description: Indicates the date and time in UTC that the warranty associated with the CPE is to expire.

parameter.name: ISPName
parameter.description: The name of the customer's ISP.

parameter.name: ISPHelpDesk
parameter.description: The help desk phone number of the ISP.

parameter.name: ISPHomePage
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's home page.

parameter.name: ISPHelpPage
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's on-line support page.

parameter.name: ISPLogo
parameter.description: Base64 encoded GIF or JPEG image. The binary image is constrained to 4095 bytes or less.

parameter.name: ISPLogoSize
parameter.description: Un-encoded binary image size in bytes. If ISPLogoSize input value is 0 then the ISPLogo is cleared. ISPLogoSize can also be used as a check to verify correct transfer and conversion of Base64 string to image size.

parameter.name: ISPMailServer
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's mail server.

parameter.name: ISPNewsServer
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's news server.

parameter.name: TextColor
parameter.description: The color of text on the GUI screens in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: BackgroundColor
parameter.description: The color of the GUI screen backgrounds in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: ButtonColor
parameter.description: The color of buttons on the GUI screens in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: ButtonTextColor
parameter.description: The color of text on buttons on the GUI screens in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: AutoUpdateServer
parameter.description: The server the CPE can check to see if an update is available for direct download to it. This MUST NOT be used by the CPE if the {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.ManagementServer.UpgradesManaged}} parameter is {{true}}.

parameter.name: UserUpdateServer
parameter.description: The server where a user can check via a web browser if an update is available for download to a PC. This MUST NOT be used by the CPE if the {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.ManagementServer.UpgradesManaged}} parameter is {{true}}.

parameter.name: ExampleLogin
parameter.description: An example of a correct login, according to ISP-specific rules.

parameter.name: ExamplePassword
parameter.description: An example of a correct password, according to ISP-specific rules.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.Layer3Forwarding.
object.description: This object allows the handling of the routing and forwarding configuration of the device.

parameter.name: DefaultConnectionService
parameter.description: Specifies the default WAN interface. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the default layer-3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''.

parameter.name: ForwardNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of forwarding instances.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.Layer3Forwarding.Forwarding.{i}.
object.description: Layer-3 forwarding table.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the forwarding entry. On creation, an entry is disabled by default.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of the forwarding entry.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Indicates the type of route.

parameter.name: DestIPAddress
parameter.description: Destination address.

parameter.name: DestSubnetMask
parameter.description: Destination subnet mask.

parameter.name: SourceIPAddress
parameter.description: Source address.

parameter.name: SourceSubnetMask
parameter.description: Source subnet mask.

parameter.name: GatewayIPAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the gateway.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: Specifies the WAN interface associated with this entry. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the layer-3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''.

parameter.name: ForwardingMetric
parameter.description: Forwarding metric. A value of -1 indicates this metric is not used.

parameter.name: MTU
parameter.description: The maximum allowed size of an Ethernet frame for this route.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANConfigSecurity.
object.description: This object contains generic device configuration information.

parameter.name: ConfigPassword
parameter.description: A password to allow LAN access to protected auto-configuration services.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.IPPingDiagnostics.
object.description: This object is provides access to an IP-layer ping test.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} Value may be set to {{enum|Requested}} to initiate the diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description:
Specifies the WAN or LAN IP-layer interface over which the test is to be performed. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the interface. The following is a WAN interface example:
: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1'' The following is a LAN interface example:
: ''InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.1.LANHostConfigManagement.IPInterface.1''

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: Host name or address of the host to ping.

parameter.name: NumberOfRepetitions
parameter.description: Number of repetitions of the ping test to perform before reporting the results.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the ping test.

parameter.name: DataBlockSize
parameter.description: Size of the data block in bytes to be sent for each ping.

parameter.name: DSCP
parameter.description: DiffServ codepoint to be used for the test packets. By default the CPE should set this value to zero.

parameter.name: SuccessCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of successful pings (those in which a successful response was received prior to the timeout) in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: FailureCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of failed pings in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: AverageResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the average response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MinimumResponseTmie
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the minimum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MaximumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the maximum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.
object.description: Each instance contains all LAN-related objects for a given bridged subnet.

parameter.name: LANEthernetInterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|LANEthernetInterfaceConfig}} in this ''LANDevice''.

parameter.name: LANUSBInterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|LANUSBInterfaceConfig}} in this ''LANDevice''.

parameter.name: LANWLANConfigurationNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WLANConfiguration}} in this ''LANDevice''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.
object.description: This object enables reporting of LAN-related device information and setting and configuring LAN IP addressing.

parameter.name: DHCPServerConfigurable
parameter.description: Enables the configuration of the DHCP server on the LAN interface. If this variable is set to {{false}}, the CPE should restore its default DHCP server settings.

parameter.name: DHCPServerEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the DHCP server on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: DHCPRelay
parameter.description: Indicates if the DHCP server performs the role of a server (0) or a relay (1) on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: MinAddress
parameter.description: Specifies first address in the pool to be assigned by the DHCP server on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: MaxAddress
parameter.description: Specifies last address in the pool to be assigned by the DHCP server on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: ReservedAddresses
parameter.description: Comma separated list of addresses marked reserved from the address allocation pool.

parameter.name: SubnetMask
parameter.description: Specifies the client's network subnet mask.

parameter.name: DNSServers
parameter.description: Comma separated list of DNS servers offered to DHCP clients. Support for more than three DNS Servers is Optional.

parameter.name: DomainName
parameter.description: Sets the domain name to provide to clients on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: IPRouters
parameter.description: Comma separated list of IP addresses of routers on this subnet. Also known as default gateway. Support for more than one Router address is Optional.

parameter.name: DHCPLeaseTime
parameter.description: Specifies the lease time in seconds of client assigned addresses. A value of -1 indicates an infinite lease.

parameter.name: UseAllocatedWAN
parameter.description: {{enum}} If {{enum|Normal}}, then DHCP addresses are to be allocated out of a private address pool. If {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet}}, instructs the CPE to allocate DHCP addresses from the WAN subnet block for the WAN connection identified in {{param|AssociatedConnection}}. If {{enum|Passthrough}}, then the specified LAN Host identified by the Passthrough MAC address is given the WAN IP address.

parameter.name: AssociatedConnection
parameter.description: Specifies the connection instance for the connection to be used for address allocation if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is set to {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet|UseAllocatedWAN}} or {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the default layer-3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''.

parameter.name: PassthroughLease
parameter.description: DHCP lease time in seconds given to the specified LAN Host when the WAN IP address is passed-through. Note: A temporary private IP address with short lease (for example, 1 min) may be given to the passthrough LAN Host before the WAN IP address is acquired.

parameter.name: PassthroughMACAddress
parameter.description: Hardware address of the LAN Host that is used to passthrough the WAN IP address if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}.

parameter.name: AllowedMACAddresses
parameter.description: Hardware addresses that are allowed to connect to this connection if ''MACAddressControlEnabled'' is 1 for a given interface.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of IP interface at LAN side of the CPE. 1 is a typical value for CPE not supporting Multihomed interfaces. Support for more than one interface instance is Optional.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.IPInterface.{i}.
object.description: IP interface table.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry. On creation, an entry is disabled by default.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceIPAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the LAN-side interface of the CPE.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceSubnetMask
parameter.description: Subnet mask of the LAN-side interface of the IGD.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceAddressingType
parameter.description: Represents the addressing method used to assign the LAN-side IP address of the CPE on this interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANEthernetInterfaceConfig.{i}.
object.description: This object models an Ethernet LAN connection on a CPE device. This object must be implemented for CPE that contain an Ethernet interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether MAC Address Control is enabled or not on this interface. MAC Address Control limits the clients that connect to those that match a list of allowed MAC addresses specified in {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.AllowedMACAddresses}}.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum upstream and downstream bit rate available to this connection.

parameter.name: DuplexMode
parameter.description: The duplex mode available to this connection.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANEthernetInterfaceConfig.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for an Ethernet LAN interface on a CPE device.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of packets sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of packets received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANUSBInterfaceConfig.{i}.
object.description: This object models a USB LAN connection on a CPE device. This object must be implemented for CPE that contain a USB interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether MAC Address Control is enabled or not on this interface. MAC Address Control limits the clients that connect to those that match a list of allowed MAC addresses specified in {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.AllowedMACAddresses}}.

parameter.name: Standard
parameter.description: USB version supported by the device.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Type of the USB interface.

parameter.name: Rate
parameter.description: Speed of the USB interface.

parameter.name: Power
parameter.description: Power configuration of the USB interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANUSBInterfaceConfig.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for a USB LAN interface on a CPE device.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: CellsSent
parameter.description: Total number of cells sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: CellsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of cells received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.
object.description: This object models an 802.11 LAN connection on a CPE device. This object must be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The MAC address of the interface.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum upstream and downstream bit rate available to this connection in Mbps. Either ''Auto'', or the largest of the {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}} values.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The current radio channel used by the connection. Note: There is currently no way of requesting automatic selection of a channel.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The current service set identifier in use by the connection. The SSID is an identifier that is attached to packets sent over the wireless LAN that functions as a "password" for joining a particular radio network (BSS). Note: If an access point wishes to be known by more than one SSID, it must provide a ''WLANConfiguration'' instance for each SSID.

parameter.name: BeaconType
parameter.description: The breacon types to be use with this connection.

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether MAC Address Control is enabled or not on this interface. MAC Address Control limits the clients that connect to those that match a list of allowed MAC addresses specified in {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.AllowedMACAddresses}}.

parameter.name: Standard
parameter.description: Indicates which IEEE 802.11 mode the device is currently operating in.

parameter.name: WEPKeyIndex
parameter.description: The index of the default WEP key.

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: A passphrase from which the WEP keys were generated. This parameter for information only-the CPE is not responsible for generating the key based on the passphrase. This parameter is the same as the parameter {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.PreSharedKey.1.KeyPassprhase}} for the same instance of ''WLANConfiguration''. When either parameter is changed, the value of the other is changed as well. This must either be a valid key length divided by 8, in which case each byte contributes 8 bits to the key, or else must consist of Hex digits and be a valid key length divided by 4, in which case each byte contributes 4 bits to the key. Note: If a passphrase is used, all four WEP keys will be the same.

parameter.name: WEPEncryptionLevel
parameter.description: Supported key lengths. {{enum}} Any additional vendor-specific values must start with the key length in bits.

parameter.name: BasicEncryptionModes
parameter.description: Encryption modes that are available when basic 802.11 is enabled. {{enum|WEPEncryption}} implies that all wireless clients can use WEP for data encryption.

parameter.name: BasicAuthenticationMode
parameter.description: Authentication modes that are available when basic 802.11 is enabled.

parameter.name: WPAEncryptionModes
parameter.description: Encryption modes that are available when WPA is enabled.

parameter.name: WPAAuthenticationMode
parameter.description: Authentication modes that are available when WPA is enabled.

parameter.name: IEEE11iEncryptionModes
parameter.description: Encryption modes that are available when 802.11i is enabled.

parameter.name: IEEE11iAuthenticationMode
parameter.description: Authentication modes that are available when 802.11i is enabled.

parameter.name: PossibleChannels
parameter.description: Possible radio channels for the wireless standard (a, b or g) and the regulatory domain. Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted. For example, for 802.11b and North America, would be "1-11".

parameter.name: BasicDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: Maximum access point data transmit rates in Mbps for unicast, multicast and broadcast frames. For example, a value of "1,2", indicates that unicast, multicast and broadcast frames can be transmitted at 1 Mbps and 2 Mbps.

parameter.name: OperationalDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: Maximum access point data transmit rates in Mbps for unicast frames (a superset of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}}). Given the value of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}} from the example above, {{param}} might be "1,2,5.5,11", indicating that unicast frames can additionally be transmitted at 5.5 Mbps and 11 Mbps.

parameter.name: PossibleDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: Data transmit rates for unicast frames at which the access point will permit a station to connect (a subset of {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}}). Given the values of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}} and {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}} from the examples above, {{param}} might be "1,2,5.5", indicating that the AP will only permit connections at 1 Mbps, 2 Mbps and 5.5 Mbps, even though it could theoretically accept connections at 11 Mbps.

parameter.name: InsecureOOBAccessEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether insecure write access via mechanisms other than the CPE WAN Management Protocol is permitted to the parameters in this object.

parameter.name: BeaconAdvertisementEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the access point is sending out beacons.

parameter.name: RadioEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the access point radio is enabled.

parameter.name: AutoRateFallBackEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether the access point can automatically reduce the data rate in the event of undue noise or contention.

parameter.name: LocationDescription
parameter.description: An XML description of information used to identify the access point by name and physical location. The CPE is not expected to parse this string, but simply to treat it as an opaque string. {{empty}} indicates no location has been set.

parameter.name: RegulatoryDomain
parameter.description: 802.11d Regulatory Domain String. First two octets are ISO/IEC 3166-1 two-character country code. The third octet is either " " (all environments), "O" (outside) or "I" (inside).

parameter.name: TotalPSKFailures
parameter.description: The number of times pre-shared key (PSK) authentication has failed (relevant only to WPA and 802.11i).

parameter.name: TotalIntegrityFailures
parameter.description: The number of times the MICHAEL integrity check has failed (relevant only to WPA and 802.11i)

parameter.name: ChannelsInUse
parameter.description: Channels that the access point determines to be currently in use (including any that it is using itself). Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted.

parameter.name: DeviceOperationMode
parameter.description: The current access-point operating mode. The optional modes permit the AP to be configured as a wireless bridge (to bridge two wired networks), repeater (a bridge that also serves wireless clients), or wireless station. Ad hoc stations are not supported.

parameter.name: DistanceFromRoot
parameter.description: The number of hops from the root access point to the wireless repeater or bridge.

parameter.name: PeerBSSID
parameter.description: The MAC address of the peer in wireless repeater or bridge mode.

parameter.name: AuthenticationServiceMode
parameter.description: Indicates whether another service is involved in client authentication ({{enum|LinkAuthentication}} for a co-located authentication server; {{enum|RadiusClient}} for an external RADIUS server).

parameter.name: TotalBytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: TotalBytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of packets sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of packets received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: TotalAssociations
parameter.description: The number of devices currently associated with the access point. This corresponds to the number of entries in the {{object|AssociatedDeivce}} table.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: A table of the devices currently associated with the access point. The size of this table is given by {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.TotalAssociations}}. This object must be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of an associated device.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceIPAddress
parameter.description: The IP address or DNS name of an associated device.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceAuthenticationState
parameter.description: Whether an associated device has authenticated ({{true}}) or not ({{false}}).

parameter.name: LastRequestedUnicastCipher
parameter.description: The unicast cipher that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address (802.11i only).

parameter.name: LastRequestedMulticastCipher
parameter.description: The multicast cipher that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address (802.11i only).

parameter.name: LastPMKId
parameter.description: The pairwise master key (PMK) that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address (802.11i only).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.WEPKey.{i}.
object.description: This is a table of WEP keys. The size of this table is fixed with exactly 4 entries (with instance numbers 1 through 4). This object must be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: WEPKey
parameter.description: A WEP key expressed as a hexadecimal string. The WEP encryption level is inferred from the key length, e.g. 10 characters for 40-bit encryption, or 26 characters for 104-bit encryption.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.PreSharedKey.{i}.
object.description: This is a table of preshared keys. The size of this table is fixed with exactly 10 entries (with instance numbers 1 through 10). This object must be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: PreSharedKey
parameter.description: A literal WPA PSK expressed as a hexadecimal string. The first table entry contains the default ''PreSharedKey'' (''InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.PreSharedKey.1.PreSharedKey'').

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: A passphrase from which WEP or PSK keys were generated. This parameter for information only-the CPE is not responsible for generating the key based on the passphrase. For WEP keys it must either be a valid key length divided by 8, in which case each byte contributes 8 bits to the key, or else must consist of Hex digits and be a valid key length divided by 4, in which case each byte contributes 4 bits to the key. For WPA PSK, the key is generated as specified by WPA, which uses PBKDF2 from PKCS #5: Password-based Cryptography Specification Version 2.0 (RFC2898).. Note: The 802.11i standard specifies rules for generation of WEP keys from a passphrase.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address associated with a preshared key, or {{empty}} if no MAC address is associated with the key.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.Hosts.
object.description: This object provides information about each of the hosts on the LAN, including those whose IP address was allocated by the CPE using DHCP as well as hosts with statically allocated IP addresses.

parameter.name: HostNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the {{object|Host}} table.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.Hosts.Host.{i}.
object.description: Host table.

parameter.name: IPAddress
parameter.description: Current IP Address of the host.

parameter.name: AddressSource
parameter.description: Indicates whether the IP address of the host was allocated by the CPE using DHCP, was assigned to the host statically, or was assigned using automatic IP address allocation.

parameter.name: LeaseTimeRemaining
parameter.description: DHCP lease time remaining in seconds. A value of -1 indicates an infinite lease. The value must be 0 (zero) if the {{param|AddressSource}} is not {{enum|DHCP|AddressSource}}.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the host.

parameter.name: HostName
parameter.description: The device's host name or {{empty}} if unknown.

parameter.name: InterfaceType
parameter.description: Type of physical interface through which this host is connected to the CPE.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not the host is currently present on the LAN. The method of presence detection is a local matter to the CPE. The ability to list inactive hosts is Optional. If the CPE includes inactive hosts in this table, this variable MUST be set to zero for each inactive host. The length of time an inactive host remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.
object.description: Each instance contains all objects associated with a particular physical WAN interface.

parameter.name: WANConnectionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WANConnectionDevice}} in this ''WANDevice''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANCommonInterfaceConfig.
object.description: This object models WAN interface properties common across all connection instances.

parameter.name: EnabledForInternet
parameter.description: Used to enable or disable access to and from the Internet across all connection instances.

parameter.name: WANAccessType
parameter.description: Specifies the WAN access (modem) type.

parameter.name: Layer1UpstreamMaxBitRate
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum upstream theoretical bit rate for the WAN device in bits per second.

parameter.name: Layer1DownstreamMaxBitRate
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum downstream theoretical bit rate for the WAN device in bits per second.

parameter.name: PhysicalLinkStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the state of the physical connection (link) from WANDevice to a connected entity.

parameter.name: WANAccessProvider
parameter.description: Name of the Service Provider providing link connectivity on the WAN.

parameter.name: TotalBytesSent
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of bytes sent upstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: TotalBytesReceived
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of bytes received downstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsSent
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of packets (IP or PPP) sent upstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of packets (IP or PPP) received downstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: MaximumActiveConnections
parameter.description: Indicates the maximum number of active connections the CPE can simultaneously support.

parameter.name: NumberOfActiveConnections
parameter.description: Number of WAN connection service instances currently active on this WAN interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANCommonInterfaceConfig.Connection.{i}.
object.description: Active connection table.

parameter.name: ActiveConnectionDeviceContainer
parameter.description: Specifies a WAN connection device object associated with this connection instance. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the WAN connection device. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2''.

parameter.name: ActiveConnectionServiceID
parameter.description: Specifies a WAN connection object associated with this connection instance. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the layer-3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.
object.description: This object models physical layer properties specific to a single physical connection of a DSL modem used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*InterfaceConfig'' object within a given ''WANDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of the DSL physical link.

parameter.name: ModulationType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of modulation used on the connection.

parameter.name: LineEncoding
parameter.description: The line encoding method used in establishing the Layer 1 DSL connection between the CPE and the DSLAM. Note: Generally speaking, this variable does not change after provisioning.

parameter.name: DataPath
parameter.description: Indicates whether the data path is fast (lower latency) or interleaved (lower error rate).

parameter.name: InterleaveDepth
parameter.description: ADSL Interleaved depth. This variable is only applicable if {{param|DataPath}} = {{enum|Interleaved|DataPath}}.

parameter.name: LineNumber
parameter.description: Signifies the line pair that the modem is using to connection. {{param}} = 1 is the innermost pair.

parameter.name: UpstreamCurrRate
parameter.description: The current payload bandwidth (expressed in Kbps) of the upstream DSL channel.

parameter.name: DownstreamCurrRate
parameter.description: The current payload bandwidth (expressed in Kbps) of the downstream DSL channel.

parameter.name: UpstreamMaxRate
parameter.description: The current attainable rate (expressed in Kbps) of the upstream DSL channel.

parameter.name: DownstreamMaxRate
parameter.description: The current attainable rate (expressed in Kbps) of the downstream DSL channel.

parameter.name: UpstreamNoiseMargin
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio (expressed in 0.1 db) of the upstream DSL connection.

parameter.name: DownstreamNoiseMargin
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio (expressed in 0.1 db) of the downstream DSL connection.

parameter.name: UpstreamAttenuation
parameter.description: The current upstream signal loss (expressed in 0.1 dB).

parameter.name: DownstreamAttenuation
parameter.description: The current downstream signal loss (expressed in 0.1 dB).

parameter.name: UpstreamPower
parameter.description: The current output power at the CPE's DSL interface (expressed in 0.1 dBmV),

parameter.name: DownstreamPower
parameter.description: The current received power at the CPE's DSL interface (expressed in 0.1 dBmV),

parameter.name: ATURVendor
parameter.description: ATU-R vendor identifier as defined in G.994.1 and T1.413.

parameter.name: ATURCountry
parameter.description: T.35 country code of the ATU-R vendor as defined in G.994.1.

parameter.name: ATURANSIStd
parameter.description: ATU-R T1.413 Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2.

parameter.name: ATURANSIRev
parameter.description: ATU-R Vendor Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2.

parameter.name: ATUCVendor
parameter.description: ATU-C vendor identifier as defined in G.994.1 and T1.413.

parameter.name: ATUCCountry
parameter.description: T.35 country code of the ATU-C vendor as defined in G.994.1.

parameter.name: ATUCANSIStd
parameter.description: ATU-C T1.413 Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2.

parameter.name: ATUCANSIRev
parameter.description: ATU-C Vendor Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2.

parameter.name: TotalStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of ''Total'' statistics. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this may not always be possible.

parameter.name: ShowtimeStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime-the beginning of the period used for collection of ''Showtime'' statistics.

parameter.name: LastShowtimeStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the second most recent DSL Showtime-the beginning of the period used for collection of ''LastShowtime'' statistics. If the CPE has not retained information about the second most recent Showtime (e.g., on reboot), the start of ''LastShowtime'' statistics MAY temporarily coincide with the start of ''Showtime'' statistics.

parameter.name: CurrentDayStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of ''CurrentDay'' statistics. The CPE MAY align the beginning of each ''CurrentDay'' interval with days in the UTC time zone, but is not required to do so. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this may not always be possible.

parameter.name: QuarterHourStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of ''QuarterHour'' statistics. The CPE MAY align the beginning of each ''QuarterHour'' interval with real-time quarter-hour intervals, but is not required to do so. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this may not always be possible.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for a WAN DSL physical interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.Total.
object.description: This object contains DSL total statistics.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Total number of successfully received blocks.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Total number of successfully transmitted blocks.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Total number of cell-delineation errors (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Total number of link-retrain errors (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Total number of initialization errors (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Total number of initialization timeout errors.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Total number of loss-of-framing errors (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of errored seconds (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of severely errored seconds (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of FEC errors detected (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of HEC errors detected (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Total number of CRC errors detected (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Total number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.Showtime.
object.description: This object contains DSL statistics accumulated since the most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully received blocks since the most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully transmitted blocks since the most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Number of cell-delineation errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Number of link-retrain errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Number of initialization errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Number of initialization timeout errors since the most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Number of loss-of-framing errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of severely errored seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.LastShowtime.
object.description: This object contains DSL statistics accumulated since the second most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully received blocks since the second most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully transmitted blocks since the second most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Number of cell-delineation errors since the second most recent DSL Showtime (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Number of link-retrain errors since the second most recent DSL Showtime (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Number of initialization errors since the second most recent DSL Showtime (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Number of initialization timeout errors since the second most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Number of loss-of-framing errors since the second most recent DSL Showtime (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds since the second most recent DSL Showtime (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of severely errored seconds since the second most recent DSL Showtime (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.CurrentDay.
object.description: This object contains DSL statistics accumulated during the current day.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully received blocks during the current day.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully transmitted blocks during the current day.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Number of cell-delineation errors during the current day (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Number of link-retrain errors during the current day (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Number of initialization errors during the current day (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Number of initialization timeout errors during the current day.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Number of loss-of-framing errors during the current day (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds during the current day (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of severely errored seconds during the current day (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected during the current day (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C during the current day (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected during the current day (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C during the current day (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected during the current day (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C during the current day (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.QuarterHour.
object.description: This object contains DSL statistics accumulated during the current quarter hour.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully received blocks during the current quarter hour.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully transmitted blocks during the current quarter hour.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Number of cell-delineation errors during the current quarter hour (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Number of link-retrain errors during the current quarter hour (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Number of initialization errors during the current quarter hour (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Number of initialization timeout errors during the current quarter hour.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Number of loss-of-framing errors during the current quarter hour (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds during the current quarter hour (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of severely errored seconds during the current quarter hour (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected during the current quarter hour (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C during the current quarter hour (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected during the current quarter hour (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C during the current quarter hour (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected during the current quarter hour (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C during the current quarter hour (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANEthernetInterfaceConfig.
object.description: This object models physical layer properties specific to a single Ethernet physical connection used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with an Ethernet WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*InterfaceConfig'' object within a given ''WANDevice'' instance. Note that this object is not related to the Ethernet protocol layer sometimes used in associated with a DSL connection.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum upstream and downstream bit rate available to this connection.

parameter.name: DuplexMode
parameter.description: The duplex mode available to this connection.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANEthernetInterfaceConfig.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for an Ethernet WAN interface on a CPE device.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of packets sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of packets received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLConnectionManagement.
object.description: This object is required for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface

parameter.name: ConnectionServiceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of table entries in the ConnectionService table.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLConnectionManagement.ConnectionService.{i}.
object.description: This table contains an entry for each connection service.

parameter.name: WANConnectionDevice
parameter.description: Specifies a WAN connection device object associated with this connection instance. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the WAN connection device. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2''.

parameter.name: WANConnectionService
parameter.description: Specifies a WAN connection object associated with this connection instance. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the layer-3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description:
Destination address of the WANConnectionDevice entry. One of:
* ''PVC: VPI/VCI''
* ''SVC: ATM connection name''
* ''SVC: ATM address''

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: Link Type of the WANConnectionDevice entry. One of Link Types as described in ''WANDSLLinkConfig''

parameter.name: ConnectionType
parameter.description: Connection Type of the ''WANPPPConnection'' or ''WANIPConnection'' entry. One of ''PossibleConnectionTypes'' as described in ''WAN**Connection'' service.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: User-readable name of the connection.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLDiagnostics.
object.description: This object is required for a CPE with an ADSL2 or ADSL2+ modem WAN interface, and optional otherwise.

parameter.name: LoopDiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} Value may be set to {{enum|Requested}} to initiate the diagnostic test, which brings down the DSL connection while the test is operating. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed, the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the corresponding reason in the Inform message.

parameter.name: ACTPSDds
parameter.description: Downstream actual power spectral density. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTPSDus
parameter.description: Upstream actual power spectral density. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTATPds
parameter.description: Downstream actual aggregate transmitter power. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTATPus
parameter.description: Upstream actual aggregate transmitter power. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: HLINSCds
parameter.description: Downstream linear representation scale. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: HLINpsds
parameter.description: Downstream linear channel characteristics per subcarrier. Each successive pair of integers represents the real and imaginary parts of each complex value. Maximum number of complex pairs is 256 for ADSL and ADSL2, 512 for ADSL2+. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: QLNpsds
parameter.description: Downstream quiet line noise per subcarrier. Maximum number of elements is 256 for ADSL and ADSL2, 512 for ADSL2+. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: SNRpsds
parameter.description: Downstream SNR per subcarrier. Maximum number of elements is 256 for ADSL and ADSL2, 512 for ADSL2+. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: BITSpsds
parameter.description: Downstream bit allocation per subcarrier. Maximum number of elements is 256 for ADSL and ADSL2, 512 for ADSL2+. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: GAINSpsds
parameter.description: Downstream gain allocation per subcarrier. Maximum number of elements is 256 for ADSL and ADSL2, 512 for ADSL2+. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.
object.description: Each instance contains objects associated with a given WAN link. In this case of DSL, each instance corresponds to a single ATM VC. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance, there are initially no connection objects contained within.

parameter.name: WANIPConnectionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WANIPConnection}} in this ''WANConnectionDevice''.

parameter.name: WANPPPConnectionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WANPPPConnection}} in this ''WANConnectionDevice''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANDSLLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the ATM layer properties specific to a single physical connection of a DSL modem used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'', this object is disabled by default.

parameter.name: LinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the link.

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of DSL connection and refers to the complete stack of protocol used for this connection.

enumeration.description: RFC2516 PPP over Ethernet on RFC2684 bridged Ethernet over ATM

parameter.name: AutoConfig
parameter.description: Indicates if the CPE is currently using some auto configuration mechanisms for this connection. If this variable is {{true}}, all writable variables in this connection instance become read-only. Any attempt to change one of these variables SHOULD fail and an error should be returned.

parameter.name: ModulationType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of DSL modulation used on the interface associated with this connection (duplication from ''WANDSLInterfaceConfig'').

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description:
Destination address of this link. One of:
* ''PVC: VPI/VCI''
* ''SVC: ATM connection name''
* ''SVC: ATM address''

parameter.name: ATMEncapsulation
parameter.description: Identifies the connection encapsulation that will be used.

parameter.name: FCSPreserved
parameter.description: This flag tells if a checksum should be added in the ATM payload. It does not refer to the checksum of one of the ATM cells or AALX packets. In case of {{enum|LLC|ATMEncapsulation}} or {{enum|VCMUX|ATMEncapsulation}} encapsulation, this ATM checksum is the FCS field described in RFC 1483. It is only applicable in the upstream direction.

parameter.name: VCSearchList
parameter.description:
Comma separated ordered list of VPI/VCI pairs to search if a link using the {{param|DestinationAddress}} cannot be established. In the form:
: ''VPI1/VCI1, VPI2/VCI2, ...'' Example:
: ''0/35, 8/35, 1/35''

parameter.name: ATMAAL
parameter.description: Describes the ATM Adaptation Layer (AAL) currently in use on the PVC.

parameter.name: ATMTransmittedBlocks
parameter.description: The current count of successfully transmitted blocks.

parameter.name: ATMReceivedBlocks
parameter.description: The current count of successfully received blocks.

parameter.name: ATMQoS
parameter.description: Describes the ATM Quality Of Service (QoS) being used on the VC.

parameter.name: ATMPeakCellRate
parameter.description: Specifies the upstream peak cell rate in cells per second.

parameter.name: ATMMaximumBurstSize
parameter.description: Specifies the upstream maximum burst size in cells.

parameter.name: ATMSustainableCellRate
parameter.description: Specifies the upstream sustainable cell rate, in cells per second, used for traffic shaping.

parameter.name: AAL5CRCErrors
parameter.description: Count of the AAL5 layer cyclic redundancy check errors.

parameter.name: ATMCRCErrors
parameter.description: Count of the ATM layer cyclic redundancy check errors.

parameter.name: ATMHECErrors
parameter.description: Count of the number of Header Error Check related errors at the ATM layer.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANATMF5LoopbackDiagnostics.
object.description: This object is provides access to an ATM-layer F5 OAM loopback test.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} Value may be set to {{enum|Requested}} to initiate the diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message.

parameter.name: NumberOfRepetitions
parameter.description: Number of repetitions of the ping test to perform before reporting the results.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the ping test.

parameter.name: SuccessCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of successful pings (those in which a successful response was received prior to the timeout) in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: FailureCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of failed pings in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: AverageResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the average response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MinimumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the minimum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MaximumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the maximum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANEthernetLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the Ethernet link layer properties specific to a single physical connection used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with an Ethernet WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance. Note that this object is not related to the Ethernet protocol layer sometimes used in associated with a DSL connection.

parameter.name: EthernetLinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the Ethernet link.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPOTSLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the POTS link layer properties specific to a single physical connection used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with a POTS WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'', this object is disabled by default.

parameter.name: LinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the link.

parameter.name: ISPPhoneNumber
parameter.description: Specifies a list of strings separated by semicolon (;), each string representing a phone number to connect to a particular ISP. The digits of the phone number follow the semantics of the ITU-T E.164 specification. Delimiters such as brackets or hyphens between the digits of a phone number are to be ignored by the CPE.

parameter.name: ISPInfo
parameter.description: Information identifying the Internet Service Provider. The format of the string is vendor specific.

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: This variable indicates the type of POTS link used for the dialup connection.

parameter.name: NumberOfRetries
parameter.description: The number of times the CPE should attempt an Internet connection setup before returning error.

parameter.name: DelayBetweenRetries
parameter.description: The number of seconds the CPE should wait between attempts to setup an Internet connection.

parameter.name: Fclass
parameter.description: Specifies capabilities of the POTS modem - i.e., if it handles data ({{enum|0}}), fax ({{enum|1}},{{enum|2}},{{enum|2.0}}), voice ({{enum|8}}), DSVD ({{enum|80}}).

parameter.name: DataModulationSupported
parameter.description: The modulation standard currently being used for data.

parameter.name: DataProtocol
parameter.description: The protocol standard currently being used for data transfers.

parameter.name: DataCompression
parameter.description: The compression technology implemented on the modem.

parameter.name: PlusVTRCommandSupported
parameter.description: Capability for full duplex operation with data and voice.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANIPConnection.{i}.
